summary: An email from an FBI Special Agent in the New York Field Office to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) regarding FOIA request handling consistency following the denial of Ghislaine Maxwell's appeal. The agent seeks guidance on whether to continue using the 'b7a' exemption due to pending appeal.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The email references Maxwell's appeal being denied, indicating she is the subject of FOIA requests and legal proceedings.

persons.name: Special Agent - FBI New York Field Office
persons.context: The author of the email, working on the Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Desk, is inquiring about FOIA request handling procedures.

events.title: FOIA Policy Inquiry Post-Maxwell Appeal
events.description: An FBI Special Agent emails the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to inquire about consistent FOIA request handling procedures following the denial of Ghislaine Maxwell's appeal.
personsInvolved: Special Agent - FBI New York Field Office

events.title: Denial of Maxwell's Appeal
events.description: The email references that Ghislaine Maxwell's appeal has been denied, a key legal development affecting FOIA response strategies.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's appeal has been denied, as of December 2024.
The FBI's New York Field Office continues to receive FOIA requests related to the Maxwell/Epstein case.
Prior to the appeal denial, the office had been using a 'b7a' FOIA exemption response due to the pending appeal.
The FBI agent is seeking guidance from the U.S. Attorney's Office to ensure consistent FOIA handling across agencies.
The correspondence indicates ongoing public and media interest in the case, prompting FOIA requests.
